regular-body: You’ll be surprised to see me getting all excited about the Mac port of a nine year old game making it on to Steam. But there’s a very good reason for it: it means the Aspyr’s unfortunate partnership with the Mac App Store is being reconsidered. The Mac App Store (MAS) is an awful platform for gamers: no special deals and promotions throughout the year, no achievements, no social gaming, no automatic updating (I think?). Steam is where gamers want to be: it’s where our friends are, it’s where the best deals are, it’s got autoupdate, and it lets me swap games around so they don’t take up too much space on my paltry hard drive. If Aspyr is playing around with bringing games on to Steam – and I really don’t see LucasArts putting pressure on them to bring their almost-decade-old game to Steam – there’s a whole bunch of fantastic Mac games which might be making their way to my favourite game store, at a price I might be able to afford. I’m hoping for more.
